page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
South West Greenock and Gourock(West) lie on the South West Bank at the mouth of the Firth of Clyde.
The block can be divided into two distinctive areas.To the West we have the sparsely populated Hilly,Moorland and Farmland region.The populated area to the east splits into two quite contrasting settlements.The Tourist, residential Town of Gourock to the North whose inhabitants live in predominantly Private Housing.The other populated settlement to the south includes the Districts of Braeside and Larkfield which are Council Estates.Like most other areas in the Inverclyde Region the major cause for Social Concern is that of Unemployment which has increased steadily as Industry has declined..
